item.title: Why Leon Kennedy Appearing in a Future Resident Evil Mainline Game Would Only Make Sense
item.description:
Highlights

  • Leon Kennedy has become a key figure in the Resident Evil franchise, making strong impressions on fans old and new.
  • Leon's prominent roles in recent games and crossovers solidify his status as the new face of the franchise.
  • It would therefore make sense for him to lead Resident Evil 9 and help define the future of the series.

Protagonists have always been some of Resident Evil 's strongest assets. While ferocious monsters and zombies are obviously very important for any horror story, having a strong cast of human survivors is arguably just as important. Fans need a central group of heroes that they can root for and inevitably feel sad about when they meet their untimely end. Resident Evil has always done a decent job of getting players to connect with its protagonists, often building that connection through both story and gameplay.

In the survival horror genre, the player is given only a limited set of resources and is tasked with surviving whatever the game throws at them. In this high-pressure scenario, the player often ends up forming a close, almost symbiotic bond with their player-character, with their own survival instincts mirroring the character's. This is why so many Resident Evil fans have such strong connections with the franchise's legacy characters, and there's one familiar face who's likely to keep coming back even more frequently than the rest.

Leon Kennedy's Resident Evil Return Seems Imminent

Leon Kennedy Has Become The Face of the Resident Evil Franchise

There have been some truly iconic Resident Evil protagonists over the years, with Chris Redfield and Jill Valentine making a huge impact with the franchise's debut game, and characters like Claire Redfield and Ada Wong making strong impressions whenever they're on-screen. But in recent years, no Resident Evil protagonist has been quite as prolific as Leon S. Kennedy.

Originally making his debut in 1998's Resident Evil 2 , Leon Kennedy has appeared in various entries throughout the franchise's long history, but one of Leon's most important roles came in 2019 with the launch of Resident Evil 2 Remake . While 2017's Resident Evil 7 was a great return to form for the franchise after the poor reception to Resident Evil 6 , it was 2019's Resident Evil 2 Remake that really restored the franchise to its former glory, and Leon Kennedy was right at the heart of it.

Earlier this year it was confirmed that Resident Evil 2 Remake is now the best-selling game in franchise history, selling over 13.9 million copies. It seems safe to assume that this remake was many new fans' first foray into the Resident Evil franchise, and as such, Leon Kennedy was probably the first protagonist many formed a connection with. This connection will have only grown deeper with the release of Resident Evil 4 Remake last year, with Leon Kennedy getting the spotlight all to himself.

In the last few years, Leon Kennedy has also appeared in a few games outside the Resident Evil franchise, featuring as a crossover character in games like Dead by Daylight and Fortnite . Though he isn't the only RE protagonist to appear in recent years, he's probably the most prolific when all is said and done, essentially becoming the new face of the franchise.

If Resident Evil Is Bringing Back Mascots, Leon Kennedy Should Be First on the List

One of the biggest rumors surrounding the upcoming Resident Evil 9 is that it will feature a handful of legacy character returns. If that turns out to be true, then it would make complete sense for Leon Kennedy to play a major role in the series' next entry, if not as the main playable character, then at least as a core part of the NPC cast. Leon Kennedy is the connective tissue that ties together veteran fans and newcomers, with the former group having loved the character for decades and the latter crowd enjoying his more recent depictions. It would make sense for Capcom to keep Leon at the heart of the Resident Evil franchise moving forward.

item.title: Co-Op Indie Games To Play With Friends
item.description:
Highlights

  • Indie games offer unique gameplay mechanics & innovations that big studios may not explore.
  • Finding the perfect game for a group of friends can be challenging, but the indie scene shines.
  • From wacky puzzles to adventurous RPGs, there is a wide array of indie games for everyone to enjoy.

In today’s day and age, gamers all over the world have access to a plethora of great choices to play together. From different PvP genres to survival and RPG games, a group of friends can enjoy many AAA titles and spend countless hours fighting, grinding, and adventuring.

And beyond that, there is a whole sea of indie titles, made with passion and love by smaller studios, and even by a single person. A lot of these games experiment with new ideas and mechanics, bold innovations that the bigger studios might not always go for. Even with fewer resources, many indie games can entertain a group of gamers with hours and hours of adventures, humor, and sometimes - pure, unmitigated chaos.

Updated on August 1, 2024, by Ivan Abadier: Finding just the right game to play with friends can be a little challenging. That one isn’t really into shooters, while another one wants nothing to do with survival titles. Not all new shiny AAA titles can capture the entire group’s attention, and that is where the indie scene shines in all its glory.

From wacky racing games to interesting RPGs to completely fresh ideas, there is something out there for everyone. It can take a bit of time to find the perfect game for the group, but there is never a shortage of supply.

23 Ship of Fools

Putting teamwork to the test on the ever-changing seas

  • Release Date : November 22, 2022
  • Developer : Fika Productions
  • Platforms : PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, GeForce Now, Microsoft Windows, Xbox Series X and Series S

Ship of Fools is a naval-based roguelike that gives players a small ship, a few cannons, and sends them into the unforgiving seas to test their spirit, coordination, and patience. Players will need to shoot their enemies from afar as well as defend themselves from boarding creatures.

The game has a charming set of playable characters as well as all the familiar hallmarks of a roguelike, with random weapons, upgrades, and many paths to choose from. Reaching all the way to the end will require a good amount of strategy, teamwork, and a touch of luck.

22 Escape Simulator

Who needs to go outside?

  • Release Date : October 19, 2021
  • Developer : Pine Studio
  • Platforms : PC

Escape rooms have gained quite a lot of popularity over the years, with limitless creativity on the creators’ part. From fantasy to the future to detectives, there are all sorts of themes and stories that people can enjoy. And the creators of Escape Simulator have done a fantastic job of translating that into video games.

Players will need to solve elaborate puzzles in order to escape different “rooms” and situations. From ancient pyramids to spaceships and beyond, there is a fantastic collection of puzzles and mysteries that a group of friends can try to get themselves out of.

21 Human Fall Flat

Simple, wacky, devious.

  • Release Date : July 22, 2016
  • Developer : No Brakes Games, Codeglue
  • Platforms : PC, Android, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4

Human Fall Flat gives players an unwieldy, awkward character to control and a collection of puzzles and physics to play with. And it is fun and games to experiment alone, but with added co-op, complete chaos ensues. And it is hilarious.

Players can somewhat attack each other, use objects to mess with others, and use a whole array of other methods of throwing each other off of cliffs and buildings. Additionally, players can try to get themselves together and solve the many interesting puzzles that the game throws at them.

20 Pico Park

Pushing teamwork and patience to the very limit of human possibilities

  • Release Date : 7 May, 2021
  • Developer : TECOPARK
  • Platforms : Nintendo Switch, Microsoft Windows

Everything about this game is very simple. Simple controls, small, cute characters, and mostly straightforward puzzles. Push a button, get the key, and open the door. Simple. The devil lies in the number of players and the near-perfect coordination required for some of the puzzles.

Can a group of friends come together and take turns jumping over the bridge? Or will everyone start trying to get there first and end up falling into the chasm, pulling everyone along with them? Will level heads and order prevail, or will everything topple down as patience runs thin?

19 Demonologist

A spooky adventure with (mostly) trusted friends

  • Release Date : 25 Sep, 2023
  • Developer : Clock Wizard Games
  • Platforms : PC

Demonologist takes a group of up to 4 players and plunges them into the unnerving world of demons and exorcism. Players can work together to unravel the secrets of many different maps filled with various otherworldly entities, and maybe even survive the journey.

With more than 20 different ghosts, every new run feels fresh and interesting. With various tools available to the players, they can either figure out the exact type of ghost and safely leave, gaining at least some reward, or they could brave the unknown and try to banish the horrifying creatures.

18 Broforce

Overflowing with testosterone and pixel brutality

Broforce is a great choice for a laid-back, explosion-filled evening. Players embody iconic various action stars, unleashing relentless firepower to free hostages and thwart terrorists. Its retro, pixelated visuals and sharp humor enhance the experience, while intuitive controls welcome all to participate.

Each level delivers unpredictable, action-packed missions, making sure no one leaves bored. The vast array of weapons and tools to play with, allows players to unleash maximum carnage, leaving no stone or villain unturned. After all, what’s not to love about saving the world with friends, while role-playing as movie action heroes?

17 Monaco: What's Yours Is Mine

Shh, do you hear that?

While this game can be played solo, it becomes an absolute rollercoaster in multiplayer. Stealth games can be quite punishing by themselves, challenging players to plan ahead, wait for just the right timing, and move with great precision. So what happens when it also requires coordination between up to four people?

Of course, that depends on the players, but chaos is all but guaranteed. The levels are big and open-ended, leaving many ways to approach the goal. With several characters, each with their own set of abilities, players can try different tactics and plans, until something inevitably goes wrong.

16 Monster Prom 3: Monster Roadtrip

The tough choices between group fun and romancing that one ghost

  • Release Date : 22 Oct, 2022
  • Developer : Beautiful Glitch
  • Platforms : PC

High-octane gameplay might not be for everyone, and there are days when players just want to kick back, and enjoy a fun, chill time with each other. The Monster Prom series has been providing that, and much more, since the release of the first entry.

This multiplayer visual novel takes its players on an interactive road trip. There are goofy adventures at every turn, and unique, well-written romance options. It can be quite the change of pace for some players, but it is a welcome and fresh perspective on what games could be.

15 Wizard With A Gun

A familiar setup with a whole new twist

  • Release Date : 17 Oct, 2023
  • Developer : Galvanic Games
  • Platforms : PC, PS5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox Series X/S

Released in 2023, this title has been warmly received by gamers all over the world. This fun, roguelike adventure features up to two wizards at a time. Players must survive in a unique and interesting world, exploring and gathering resources to improve their magical gear and spells.

The combat is fun and engaging, with many interesting powers at the players’ disposal. The combat is far from boring. Certain enemies are resistant to certain types of damage and spells, making players consider and adjust their tactics and weapons as the game progresses.

14 Viscera Cleanup Detail

A menial chore, turned into a surprisingly elaborate and chaotic activity

  • Release Date : 24 Oct, 2015
  • Developer : RuneStorm
  • Platforms : PC

Viscera Cleanup Detail takes a rather boring premise — cleaning up — and turns it into a fun and chaotic game that can forge and destroy friendships. In the game, the players are tasked with cleaning up the scenes of a battle (presumably from a Doom -like shooter) by removing the debris and the aftermath of a battlefield.

While the idea is simple enough, the devil lies in the actual cooperation from players. While one player might be intensely trying to mop the floor, someone else might drop the bucket of goop onto the clean surface, ruining the entire progress, which some players might find…infuriating.

13 Golf With Your Friends

Collision should be turned on

As advertised! This lovely indie title brings the beloved mini golf to virtual space, allowing players everywhere to challenge each other in a series of different goal courses. As competitive as the idea already is, the game kicks it up a notch by adding unique mechanics like explosions, teleportations, shoving, and sabotage.

With many beautiful and creative levels to choose from, players can enjoy many entertaining hours of hashing it out with their friends, or practice by themselves to try and get that elusive hole-in-one. The game offers a high level of replayability, with different physics, settings, and even ball shapes.

12 Risk of Rain 2

A colorful, chaotic, dynamic experience

Risk of Rain 2 is an incredibly fun and engaging rogue-like, allowing players to choose one of many characters and try to survive through 5 different stages. Every character has a completely unique playstyle, and every run feels fresh. And of course, players can team up to try and survive the unforgiving world together.

The game loop can be incredibly addictive, with different powerups and many possible builds to try out. With three different difficulty levels to choose from, players can tailor their experience to be just right for them, and enjoy the hectic gameplay and vibrant color scheme to the fullest.

11 We Were Here Series

What does it take to survive?

This series offers a cooperative escape room experience, with elements of horror sprinkled throughout. Two players take the roles of explorers, solving different puzzles while relying on each other through communicating with radios. Players are playing in different locations, each with their own set of challenges and information.

Teamwork is key here, as the players need to cooperate by sharing their knowledge and working together to escape their difficult predicament. One should also practice patience, for those times that their partner fails to see the obvious clues on their side, and proceeds to accidentally kill their buddy on the radio.

10 Spiritfarer

A philosophical journey

Spiritfarer is a unique management game, where two players fill the role of taking souls on their final journey through the doors of death. While that may sound somewhat dark, the game itself is incredibly beautiful and positive, allowing players to sail through the magic seas and care for the lost souls.

Players can build and manage their ships, decorate rooms, and gather resources on the many fantastical islands in the game. With a beautiful story, incredible lore, and philosophy, this is a great game to experience with a friend or a loved one.

9 Cuphead

Good enough to make it to the TV screens

Cuphead is definitely one kind of a game. From the fantastic art style to brutal boss fights and unforgiving levels, the packaged experience is like no other. Wrapped with a great soundtrack, the entire thing is an artistic treat. And what better way to experience it, than side by side with a gaming buddy?

Players can try and complete the game’s many challenges together, bringing down ruthless bosses one by one. While the difficulty is nothing to sneeze at, with a bit of practice and a fair amount of patience, players can learn the ropes and excel at dodging, parrying, and attacking in no time.

8 Project Zomboid

Sharing bandages and axes is caring

Project Zomboid separates itself from similar zombie survival games by shifting the perspective and adding its unique system of perks, stats, and various mechanics that factor into one’s survival. With many backstories to choose from, players can make new and different characters every time, with their own skills and proficiencies.

Surviving with friends is both a blessing and a curse, as there is more manpower, but the resources now have to be split among the crew. The game offers many tense and blood-clotting moments, where friends will be left with a choice: heroically help out their fellow survivors, or run away and hope no one finds out.

7 Core Keeper

Cozy and familiar, yet new and intriguing

Core Keeper is an interesting spin on a farming simulator, borrowing from similar games from the genre, while adding many things of its own. With an emphasis on fighting and exploring, the game has a great perk system, allowing players to choose their specialty and fill a niche role within the group.

There are many interesting builds and locations, allowing players to engage with what they find the most enjoyable. From fishing to mining to growing crops, everyone can play the way they like to, while being helpful to the group.

6 Don't Starve Together

A tried and true classic

Don’t Starve Together throws the players into a bizarre world, with an atmosphere like no other. Players will need to prepare and fend off the countless monsters and hazards of the world, and always keep in mind the game’s name.

While on paper more players should equal more helping hands and firepower, that also comes with needing more resources to feed and outfit everyone. Ultimately, players will need to carefully balance resource management with exploration and combat. But in the end, players can have incredible adventures together, filled with exploration, hardships, and unmitigated chaos.

5 Spelunky 2

Let chaos reign!

Spelunky 2 builds on the very successful premise of the first game and improves almost every single aspect. The chaotic, high-octane platformer is still a great game to enjoy with friends, while desperately trying not to get in each other’s way. With so many new weapons and items, there is so much more that co-op now has to offer.

And if at some point the tensions rise too much, players can always battle it out in the Arena, unleashing all the frustration on their friends for all the times they accidentally dropped a rock on top of their head.

4 OverCooked 2

How about fighting over spilled soup instead?

The great cooking simulator is back! This sequel mostly keeps the familiar formula from the first installment but adds a few mechanics and aspects to spice things up. Players can now throw their held dishes, which really speeds up the entire process, but can also lead to disaster if used carelessly.

With many new levels, ever-changing environments, and moving tables, chaos is almost inevitable. But should the players find their rhythm and coordination, the game feels very fun and rewarding. After all, it might not be that different from trying to cook with your friends in real life.

item.title: GTA Online Player Makes Bizarre Find Inside Their Submarine
item.description:
Highlights

  • Submarines in GTA Online offer players various benefits, including the ability to use guided missile systems.
  • A player discovered unexpected contraband (weed pallets) in their submarine's command center.
  • The presence of contraband likely due to PC cheaters.

A GTA Online player became quite confused when they discovered unexpected contraband on their Kosatka submarine. The fan shared their discovery with other GTA Online players, hoping to find an answer behind the abnormal appearance.

Submarines are one of the many kinds of vehicles that players can acquire in GTA Online . They are quite expensive, but provide players with numerous benefits. In addition to serving as a starting point for select missions, players can also use the sub to move to different parts of the map, house their submersible vehicles, and even target enemy players with the sub's guided missile system. It may be this last particular feature that led to this player finding something so odd on their ship.

GTA Online player Tomppari shared their finding with fellow fans on Reddit, jokingly accusing Pavel of having put the unexpected contraband there. The screenshot shows the sub's command center, where Pavel is keeping himself busy, but more importantly, two large pallets of weed are sitting in front of some of the control panels. Players can come across large amounts of drugs in the game like this, but generally they're found in a player's businesses, like the GTA Online nightclub or their weed farm. They're not supposed to appear in submarines under any normal circumstances.

Why Did Contraband Appear on a GTA Online Player's Sub?

Fellow players were quite amused at the find, with several making jokes about Pavel having a side business, or deciding to use his cut of the profits the player earns on whatever he likes. One fan wondered at the practicality of getting a forklift to load up the pallets onto a submarine of all things. However, there's a likely reason for the presence of the contraband: PC cheaters. A player noted that the contraband stack is piled up right in front of the control panel the player would need to use in order to access the sub's guided missile system.

As fans pointed out, while the guided missiles are a great feature to have, they're not so much fun to be a target of. Some fans hate seeing submarines pop up on the map as much as others loathe the presence of the Oppressor MK 2, the armed flying bike that players use to wreak havoc from the sky on unsuspecting players. The theory goes that a PC modder or cheater spawned these contraband flats in the sub to block Tomppari from using their guided missiles. While it's ultimately a form of cheating, it's a relatively harmless way of preventing players from griefing others with a submarine.

However, this does underscore an ongoing problem in GTA Online . While steps have been taken to combat cheaters, both GTA Online and Red Dead Online have significant cheating problems. Some players use them to get their own character ahead, while others choose to make lives living hell for anyone else trying to enjoy the game. Comparatively, this particular cheater was seemingly just trying to keep the peace, but fans would nonetheless like to see the cheating issue resolved.

item.title: PlayStation App Adds Useful Feature
item.description:
Highlights

  • The latest PlayStation App update adds convenient trophy tracking shortcuts.
  • The PlayStation App continues to improve, offering access to the store, friend messaging, game tips, and more.
  • PS5 players could benefit from new features like easy trophy tracking via the app's latest update.

Sony has pushed an update to the official PlayStation App that makes tracking trophies much more convenient during gameplay. Prior to this update, PlayStation App users could only view the trophies they acquired from playing games on their consoles, but Sony has now added some neat functionality that trophy hunters will likely appreciate.

The PlayStation App has been around since the PlayStation 4's launch in 2013, and Sony has made major strides to improve it over the years. In its current state, the app allows players to access the PlayStation Store and make purchases, manage their active PlayStation Plus subscription, catch up on PlayStation-related news, install games on their console (only if it's in rest mode), view their trophies, message their friends, look up other players, and much more. The app is regularly updated and occasionally adds new features, such as the PlayStation Stars loyalty program back in 2022.

Sony has also been making efforts to synergize functionality between the app and the console, with one of the best examples being the ability to share PS5 screenshots from the PlayStation App. Now, the recent 24.7.0 update for the PlayStation App on iOS and Android further harnesses this synergy to make trophy tracking easier for PS5 and PS4 players by somewhat offloading it to the app. Users who update the PlayStation App will be greeted with a landing page informing them of helpful shortcuts that will show up on the app whenever they are playing a game on their linked console.

These shortcuts will lead the user to activities like game tips and trophies on the PlayStation App itself, where they can then view their trophies as they play without having to back out of the game on their console. Since viewing trophy lists is a three-step process in the PS5's UI at the very least, this PlayStation App update adds a lot of convenience for trophy hunters, as they won't need to constantly exit the game screen on their PS4/PS5 to check trophy progress or minor requirements. Players can also use one of the shortcuts to accept multiplayer invites if the PlayStation App is open at the same time, further expanding Sony's recent emphasis on helpful multiplayer features for PS5 users.

Trophy hunting is an essential component of the PlayStation experience for many players, and it's encouraging to see that Sony recognizes it and endeavors to streamline the process. Previous PS5 updates added big quality-of-life changes for trophy hunters, and the PlayStation App's extended functionality should make trophy tracking even simpler now.

PlayStation App Version 24.7.0 Patch Notes

  • This update includes fixes and performance improvements.
  • Profile Share: Share your profile or another player's with a QR code or by sending a direct link.
  • Track trophies using shortcuts in the PS App.

item.title: The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom - 6 Most Exciting Features Confirmed To Be In The Game
item.description:
The Nintendo Direct from June had a lot of great reveals in it like a new RPG in the Mario franchise, Mario & Luigi: Brothership . Another big reveal was The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom . Not only was it a surprise to see Zelda as the star, but Nintendo announced its release date was imminent.

More companies should adopt this strategy instead of revealing something years before its release. 2017’s teaser trailer for Metroid Prime 4 says hello. Now, there were a lot of things shown in the trailer for The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom . Let’s get into some of the more exciting confirmed features.

6 The Power Of The Tri Rod

Creative Solutions To Problems

The biggest feature shown in the trailer is the overall gimmick of the game and one of the strangest in the Zelda series. Zelda befriends a fairy named Tri who gives her the Tri Rod. With it, Zelda can create copies of objects in The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom called Echoes.

With a simple tap of her Tri Rod, Zelda can copy objects like tables, boxes, and even trampolines. It seems like she can create an endless supply of them, so right now it is unknown if there is a hidden magic meter or a limit. As to how many Echoes there are in the game, even the producer, Eiji Aonuma, doesn’t know as he says in the trailer. It’s an interesting weapon to give Zelda instead of a sword like Link.

5 Experimenting With Objects

From Riding Tops To Gliding

Zelda can not only make objects appear to solve puzzles by hopping on them, but she can use them in more creative ways. Having the direct ability to jump, as a side note, is a big deal for the Zelda franchise too. Anyway, in the trailer, she can conjure an object that looks like the Spinner item from The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess . She stands on it and destroys enemies in her path.

So, it is confirmed that Zelda can at least ride some objects in the game but whether there are more is a mystery. Besides riding atop objects, Zelda can hold some too. At one point she can be seen gliding in a volcano via a bird. In another instance, Zelda can be seen using a robotic Octorok-looking creature who shoots rocks at enemies.

4 Collecting And Controlling Baddies

Pokemon + Pikmin

As if creating Echoes wasn’t cool enough, Zelda can zap enemies with the Tri Rod too. In the trailer, it seems like enemies can sometimes leave an Echo behind as much as they can leave materials like Hearts or Rupees behind. Players can then harness monsters to send after others.

Nintendo is no stranger to making games wherein players catch monsters and unleash them onto enemies aka the Pokemon series. There are some strategies for this mechanic as well. Players can turn meat into an Echo to lure others away, like the Crows seen in the trailer. Once gathered, players can then make a trap via hungry plants to finish enemies like the Crows off in one fell swoop.

3 Exploring A New Version Of Hyrule In This Art Style

From Jungles To Deserts

It’s exciting to get another top-down Zelda game as it has been a while. Not counting The Legend of Zelda: Link’s Awakening remake in 2019, the last new top-down entry was in 2015 via The Legend of Zelda: Tri Force Heroes . The top-down perspective is classic but there is another cool angle shown in the trailer.

Zelda can go into 2D areas just like in The Legend of Zelda: Link’s Awakening . She’s shown several times underwater and even once traversing a cave full of spiders. The game is set in Hyrule which looks like it has a diverse set of biomes from normal plains to dusty deserts to tropical jungles. The jungle setting even has rain so maybe the weather will play a big factor in exploration too which is exciting.

2 Interacting With The Rifts

Solve Puzzles In An Inter-Dimensional Adventure

Besides the Tri Rod, the other big gimmick in The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom is that rifts are opening up all over Hyrule. Link is sucked in but some NPCs fall victim too. It’s not shown how, but Zelda can be seen in the trailer within a rift, harvesting water.

She then uses that water on land to scale up a cliff. Later, fire is shown which can also be manipulated to burn a field of grass, so elements will play a role beyond the aforementioned rainy jungle. As for the rifts, it will be interesting to see how Nintendo uses these areas to engage players.

1 Link Is Also Playable

Will There Be More Characters

This is a revelation not shown in the trailer but it has been revealed that Link will be playable. This news comes from the official ESRB website for The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom’s rating. The direct quote is as follows: “As Link, players use a sword and arrows to defeat enemies.” It's odd when the ESRB makes leaks like this unintentionally.

Now is not the time for speculation as it is unknown how far this playtime with Link will extend. Will Link be playable just in that opening dungeon to defeat Ganon or can players try and escape the rift dimension as Link? Hopefully, Nintendo will leave this as a surprise and not show Link in any more trailers. It’s more fun going into a game to find a new hero playable kind of like how Solid Snake was replaced by Raiden in Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty .
